annonstext:
Are you a production/process engineer who wants to take the next step in your career? At Profoto, you will be working in a fast-growing company that provides world-class products to the world’s best image creators. Would you like to work in an international environment with world leading products, this position is for you!

What we are looking for
We are looking for a Senior Process Engineer to our headquarter in Sundbyberg. You will be part of the Operations & Quality Team and the department responsible of Quality and Cost of our product. The production is fully outsourced, which will give you the opportunity to work with international sub-suppliers. You will lead the industrialization of new products as part of the New Product Development Team and work closely to our suppliers and ensure that the delivery is in line with Profoto expectations.

Key responsibilities
As the leading brand on our market, Profoto always strives to deliver world-class quality as it is central to our brand promise. You will be fully responsible for and work with both operational and strategic activities. Other responsibilities:

- Lead the industrialization of the new products all the way from product idea to volume production
- Secure COGS and Quality of the products in production

This will be reached by:

- Leading internal and external project resources as well as our European and Asian partners resources to ensure Profoto’s process is followed
- Secure and lead the implementation of the Engineering Change Order in production
- Perform regular process audits at the supplier facilities
- Contribute to the improvement of the industrialization & engineering change order processes
- Support KPI development, follow-up and reporting on cost, yield and production capacity
- Lead/participate in Product Claim analysis before potential re-engineering of existing products Lead/participate in Root Cause Analysis activities for the chosen identified failure.

Requirements
We expect that you have a good understanding of manufacturing processes and continuous improvement methods, as well as

- 3-5 years relevant experience within a manufacturing/development organization, preferably including some electronics and mechanics assembly.
- Experienced in project management, stakeholder management and communication

- Proven previous experience within production engineering management
- Documented knowledge of manufacturing and/or quality management
- Experienced in practical problem solving methodologies (e.g. 8D, A3…)

- Knowledge of Lean, Six Sigma or similar improvement frameworks
- Fluent in English, spoken and written.
- Relevant Master of Science degree or equivalent
- Ability to travel: 30-50 days/year

Your profile
You enjoy working in a dynamic, result driven and innovative environment. Moreover, you are skilled in influencing others to get things done. You can work either on process development level or hands-on when required. As we have operations in different parts of the world we want you to be open minded and handle cross functional activities and cultures specificities. You are a team player who want to develop your project management, stakeholder management and problem-solving skills.

Want to join Profoto - The Light Shaping Company?
If you feel you have what it takes to become the next Senior Process engineer, please send an application with your CV, personal letter, and education records from university and high school. If you have any questions regarding role, please contact FIRSTNAME LASTNAME, Production Manager,  TELEPHONENO .

Last day to apply is 8th April 2021. Interviews will take place on a continuous basis, so apply today!

What we offer
Innovation has secured our position as the leading choice for the world's best photographers. So, our culture is creative, entrepreneurial, forward thinking and agile. That's why we're looking for the very best and the very brightest to help make us better. Talented and driven people who are keen to enter a growing and fast-paced environment where responsibility is given early.

We are committed to growth and we want our people to grow with us. To achieve this we offer an ambitious, high quality and demanding culture where we value to have fun together as we build a world class company with a premium brand. We strongly believe and therefore offer our employees freedom and trust, coaching leadership and strong individual development. This is massively important for us because ultimately - your success is our success.
